item.title: IKEA
item.dc:creator: justincox
item.description:

The post IKEA appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
item.content:encoded:
If you’re looking for some quality Swedish food you need look no further than IKEA. The convent part is that the restaurant lies in the middle of the giant IKEA maze, so after spending a few hours looking at furniture, you can stop and have an inexpensive bite to eat.

Pictured above is the Swedish meatball plate, which is kind of a staple. If you haven’t had it, it’s worth a visit. That plate is $3.99. I mean, come on, it’s so good and worth it.

Also pictured is the pulled pork plate, which was the special of the day, and an apple pie. The day we were there, IKEA was running a special where the dessert was free with purchase of a meal. Not bad.

And, if I remember correctly, this weekend (as in today and tomorrow) your meal is free with a store purchase of $100 or more. Buy your meal, and then when you check out downstairs with furniture, they’ll deduct the meal receipt from the total. Not bad.

So head over to IKEA and get some great food, and maybe a table or something.

The post IKEA appeared first on Chow Down Orlando.
